properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:28AM CST until January 14 at 2:30PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Northeastern Rankin County in central Mississippi...
Scott County in central Mississippi...

* Until 230 PM CST.

* At 1128 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. One to three inches of rain
have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin
shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Forest, Morton, Harperville, Pelahatchie, Homewood, Leesburg,
Goshen Springs, Pulaski, Steele, Hillsboro, Forkville, Pisgah,
Branch and Fannin.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 2:30 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
